project.teaser: GreenPaths addresses the complex and multi-dimensional nature of the planned transition. Based on an enhanced understanding of key issues and challenges influencing the transitions and an in-depth review and synthesis of the latest and most relevant research, GreenPaths will...
project.objective:
GreenPaths addresses the complex and multi-dimensional nature of the planned transition. Based on an enhanced understanding of key issues and challenges influencing the transitions and an in-depth review and synthesis of the latest and most relevant research, GreenPaths will enable the development and adoption of more coherent and effective policy strategies and instruments, furthering the positive outcomes and reducing the negative impacts on environmental sustainability and social well-being. To improve the design, governance and implementation of transition strategies, GreenPaths pays particular attention to the European Green Deal, the Fit for 55 package, and the actions funded by the Just Transition Fund and the European Social Fund+.
Key objectives include: 1) mapping and explaining links between policies, environmental sustainability and social well-being; 2) identify and assess indicators and tools to analyse interactions between climate interdependencies, environmental sustainability and social well-being; 3) develop systemic, in-depth and innovative understandings of green transition policies and approaches vis-à-vis social impacts and trade-offs; 4) offer new insights into the relevance and significance of institutional, regulatory and legal frameworks affecting the green transitions; 5) produce policy recommendations for desirable changes in European and national policies through a multi-stakeholder backcasting approach and the participatory design of lighthouse projects and facilitate an enhanced civil society-stakeholder-policy dialogue on green transition pathways.
These objectives will be achieved by the well positioned, consortium with long experience on the topic through a comprehensive mixed-methods approach, to be tested and grounded in a series of case studies, which lead into a more participatory and influential engagement with policymakers, civil society organisations and other relevant stakeholders.
project.title: GREEN-PATHS: European Knowledge Hub On Just Transition Pathways

result.title: Communication, dissemination and exploitation Plan
result.description: It is a report on the tailored communication, dissemination and exploitation for specific audiences as a follow up of the T6.1 and a preliminary result of T6.3. D6.3 is led by FOEE with the support of INTERMON, TNI, IPE and EnaBanda.

result.title: Mid-term report on communication, dissemination, and exploitation
result.description: Produced by UC in T10.4 with input and revision from all partners as a result of the communication, dissemination and exploitation actions performed in all WPs up to M18. Description: Update of the strategy for communication, dissemination, and exploitation (D6.3) including a summary activity report of the related actions done in the first 18 months.

details.authors: Judith Clifton, Daniel Diaz,Vedran Horvat,Daniel Chavez

result.title: Evidence-based communication platform: The GREENPATHS Hub
result.description: Deriving from task 6.4, D6.4 is led by INTERMON, and assisted by TNI, FOEE and IPE with the support of UvA, UC, USIEGEN, RISTECO, IUC, EnaBanda, PNG, CES and Zajednicko. It consists in a report of the interactive space on green transitions in Europe hosted at the project’s website. On the website, the results of the findings obtained from the GREENPATHS project will be made available. To promote the hub, a promotional video and an explanatory webinar will be carried out.

result.title: Data Management Plan
result.description: Produced as a result of T9.2 by UC with input and revision from all partners. Description: Plan for outlining how data will be generated, collected, stored, handled, shared, and maintained during the execution of the project.

result.title: From Policy to Plate Advancing Healthy, Sustainable and Just Public Food Procurement in the EU

result.teaser: GreenPaths is a Coordination and Support Action project that addresses the complex & multi-dimensional nature of the planned transition & aims to focus on supporting a "just" transition. Based on an enhanced understanding of the key issues & challenges influencing the...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Interim Data Management Plan
result.description: Produced as a result of T10.3 by UC with input and revision from all partners. Description: Report on how data was generated, collected, stored, handled, shared, and maintained during project execution up to month 18. Updates D9.2

result.title: Report on the GREENPATHS seminar in Brussels
result.description: Derived from Task 1.3, this report will summarise the proceedings of the first European seminar to be organised by the project in Brussels. Lead: TNI, assisted by FOEE, UC and INTERMON.

result.title: Review report on institutional frameworks and tools linked to green transitions
result.description: Produced as a result of T2.3 by USIEGEN with input and revision from CES, UC, UvA, IPE, INTERMÓN, Zajedničko, EnaBanda and PNG.D2.3 consists of a review report on institutional frameworks and tools linked to green transitions. This includes documenting past or current limitations and the identifications gaps that might con- tribute to the design of the 15 case studies to be conducted in WP3, the analysis of institutional, regulatory and legal frameworks planned for WP5, and the participatory backcasting analysis and lighthouse projects to be implemented in WP5.

result.title: RAPPORTO DEL SEMINARIO La Ristorazione Scolastica in un Contesto Politico in Evoluzione: Dal “Green Deal” al “Clean Industrial Plan” Italian Version
Discussion paper and set of infographics on the links between green transition policy interventions, environmental sustainability and social wellbeing
result.description: Derived from Task 1.1, D1.1 involves the production of a discussion paper and set of infographics showing the links between green transition policy interventions, environmental sustainability and social wellbeing. Lead: UC with input and revised from all partners: TNI, USIEGEN, CES, UvA, IPE, INTERMON, IUC, RISTECO, PNG, Zajednicko, EnaBanda, and FOEE.

result.title: GREENPATHS analytical framework, comprising indicators and tools
result.description: Related to T2.4 and drawing on the results of Tasks 1.1-1.3, and 2.1-2.3, it consists of a comprehensive analytical framework, comprising indicators and tools, for the implementation of WP3. It is produced by CES with support from IPE, USIEGEN and EnaBanda.

result.title: Preliminary assessment of the approaches and methodologies currently used to identify, foresee and assess green transitions policy interventions in Europe
result.description: Derived from Task 1.2, this deliverable implies a comprehensive research paper providing an overview and an initial appraisal of the approaches and methodologies currently influencing the design and implementation of policy interventions in the broad area of green transitions. Lead: TNI, with inputs from CES, IPE and USIEGEN.

result.title: GREENPATHS project website
result.description: Derived from task 6.1, it is led by TNI and assisted by INTERMON and UC with support from FOEE, RISTECO, IUC, CES, IPE, PNG; USIEGEN, UvA, EnaBanda, and Zajednicko. The project’s website will consist of an internal space for communication among the GREEN-PATHS consortium members, and an external website that will provide information about the project’s objectives, structure and progress.

result.title: National Seminar Report: School Food Service in a Changing Policy Landscape: From “ The Green Deal” to “The Clean Industrial Plan”. English version
Set of enhanced indicators for assessing the social impacts of green transitions
result.description: Deriving from Task 2.1, D.2.1 is led by INTERMON with support of UC and USIEGEN. It consists in a collection of improved and refined indicators that can be used to evaluate the social effects of transitioning towards environmentally sustainable practices. These indicators are designed to capture a wider range of social impacts, such as employment, social protection, and equity, among others.

result.title: Review report on previous research projects linked to green transitions
result.description: Produced as a result of T2.2 by USIEGEN with input and revision from INTERMÓN, UC and TNI. D2.2 consists of a review report on previous research projects linked to green transitions and shows an emphasis on the methodologies and approaches used to assess economic, social and distributional impacts

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
